stimulusHtml: The function f is defined on the closed interval [0, 1] and satisfies f ( 0 ) = f ( 1 2 ) = f ( 1 ) . On the open interval (0, 1), f is continuous and strictly increasing. Which of the following statements is true?
choicesHtml: f attains both a minimum value and a maximum value on the closed interval [0, 1].
f attains a minimum value but not a maximum value on the closed interval [0, 1].
f attains a maximum value but not a minimum value on the closed interval [0, 1].
f attains neither a minimum value nor a maximum value on the closed interval [0, 1].
